title: Pulis 'called Shawcross a loser'
text:
Mark Hughes claims Tony Pulis called Ryan Shawcross a 'loser' in voicemail message  29pm Ryan Shawcross (second L) was Tony Pulis' Stoke captain for years Tony Pulis rang Ryan Shawcross and called him "a loser" after West Brom beat Stoke last weekend, Mark Hughes has claimed. 
Shawcross was Pulis' captain at Stoke for several years before the manager moved on in 2013, and the centre-half started the Potters' 1-0 defeat by the Baggies at The Hawthorns last Saturday. 
That game was played against the backdrop of Saido Berahino's switch from West Brom to Stoke and the subsequent revelation the striker had served a drugs ban. 
Hughes and Pulis did not shake hands at the final whistle, and the circumstances surrounding the game were still on the Stoke boss' mind six days later. 
"We were annoyed with a number things," Hughes said. "I was annoyed with their manager ringing up Ryan on the Monday morning after the game and calling him a loser. I wasn't too happy with that. West Brom 1-0 Stoke 
"Any number of things surrounding the game were, in our view, unnecessary. There was a voicemail left, and I haven't heard it. But Ryan wasn't too pleased. He tried to ring back and didn't get any answer." 
Shawcross has accused Albion of leaking details of Berahino's ban and Pulis, speaking on Friday, said: "Ryan has tried to ring me since that [the quotes on Berahino] and I will get back to him." Also See:
